author: sky.cactus
content: Your first reason is explicitly the reason I like `eth_call` as the example, it will force us to deal with cross-client inconsistencies and thus allow us to show the full path.  Your argument that `eth_getTransactionByHash` is changing soon is also compelling, as that is another piece that I think we need to exercise in our "example".

author: sky.cactus
content: Just create a new file in https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/tree/master/EIPS that follows the instructions in https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ethereum/EIPs/master/eip-template.md.  Though, I still weakly argue that we should start with defining *current* behavior across all clients in the eth1.0-specs repository and then create an EIP that proposes a *change* to that.

author: sky.cactus
content: eth1.0-specs I think is a good place.  We'll need <@!187490121698770945> to carve out a folder for us to put JSON-RPC specs in if we want to go that route, and perhaps name some people with merge rights so we don't get blocked on James being the only one who can merge.  ðŸ™‚

author: samajammin
content:
Hey <@!489256758989029405> <@!187490121698770945> - let me know if it'd be helpful for me to join the next call. If so, much appreciated if you could send me a calendar invite (sam.richards@ethereum.org).

Quick update on our end, we do have a PR up add the api docs to ethereum.org: https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website/pull/2352
We welcome input on this. If anything, the thought here is to provide a short term improvement over the current eth.wiki page.

author: 0x6e69636f
content: No that's fine, thanks! I thought there was already some ongoing discussion about it, but I agree that we can totally handle that here.

author: tjayrush
content: If I wanted to try to invite a few "Node-as-a-service" folks (assuming I can find contact info), would this channel be the right place to point them if they wanted to get involved?

author: sky.cactus
content: Probably a good place to start at the least.  ðŸ™‚

author: sky.cactus
content: Getting them on the calls would be another starting place.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think <@489256758989029405> is the maintainer of the call email list.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Good point.  Maybe we try to do all three to start?  If we get stalled out on one for different reasons hopefully the other two can still make progress and the lessons learned from each can cross-apply quickly.
